name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"a022602c-6006-475f-860c-12782417cc2b","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Group: Identity & Type Classification","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cb39d6bc-a739-43b8-bc02-c7d9f0b33ddd","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This group of methods within the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Definition","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" class handles the core categorization and identification of program entities. In static analysis, knowing ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"what","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":" a symbol represents is the first step toward understanding its behavior. These functions allow the analysis engine to distinguish between local variables, class definitions, and executable functions, while providing access to their unique naming structures.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"980a01be-150a-4f36-b60e-cf91d48341c9","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"ae19876f-01cb-40fa-a892-b81848bf927c","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Methods","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6a627a84-3116-4b5d-b032-ba328b20b344","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"__init__(fullns, def_type)

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Initializes the definition by assigning its location in the project hierarchy (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"fullns","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") and its classification (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"def_type","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"). It also prepares the internal structures for tracking value history (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"points","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), fallbacks (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"bias","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), and associated code lines (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"lines","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0408ee23-23bc-4bec-b72c-643d514b5e7d","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_type()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Returns the categorical type of the definition (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"NAME_DEF","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"CLS_DEF","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"FUN_DEF","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"). This helps the analyzer decide which logic to apply—for instance, whether to look for internal methods or to evaluate it as a data constant.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7646d2ee-54d7-45f1-a92b-743a213466c4","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_name()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Extracts the "short" name of the entity. For a namespace like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"app.services.auth.login","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", this method returns ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":""login"","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This is particularly useful for generating human-readable reports or matching identifiers in source code.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3b726b0c-74f3-4858-a413-fd3398dc8e44","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_ns()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Returns the full string path of the definition. This serves as the unique identifier used to look up the definition in the global symbol table.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7e3d4556-a02b-49e1-b251-e206fabe3ec9","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"is_function_def()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"A boolean helper that identifies if the entity is a internal function definition.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"70e19c8b-866f-4c8b-95ee-12afd9fb4bef","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"is_ext_def(row=0)

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"A boolean helper that identifies if the entity is an external definition. These usually represent third-party libraries or symbols whose source code is not part of the current analysis project.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"92f34695-104b-40aa-8325-bfd2ea071f5d","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"is_callable()

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Determines if the entity can be invoked. It returns ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"True","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" if the definition is either a function or an external reference, signaling to the engine that it should prepare for a function-call analysis.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"db9104fe-8b1f-4c9c-aac1-5073200e45cc","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"5b3f2d3d-223a-44a9-baa5-7bdcdd72fffe","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Usage Example","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4dbd3d60-4581-4953-a690-2ee3e3ef0e46","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"import utils
from points import Definition

# Create a definition for a class method
# Full namespace: app.models.User.save
# Type: Function Definition
user_save = Definition("app.models.User.save", utils.constants.FUN_DEF)

# 1. Identify the name and full path
print(user_save.get_name()) # Output: save
print(user_save.get_ns())   # Output: app.models.User.save

# 2. Check capabilities
if user_save.is_callable():
    print("This entity can be invoked as a function.")

# 3. Type check
if user_save.get_type() == utils.constants.FUN_DEF:
    print("This is a standard function definition.")","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f67ec7e2-8613-46b5-a075-06be3bd633c3","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Insights","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9ea639dd-bebc-4c73-9d60-e3e64a204af6","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Namespace Separation","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": By separating the "Name" from the "Namespace," Jarvis can keep track of multiple variables named ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"id","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as long as they reside in different scopes.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8b368482-d16a-4855-a51a-2409573cb987","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Abstracting Complexity","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"is_callable","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method abstracts away the difference between calling a local function and calling an imported library function, simplifying the high-level traversal logic.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"49176928-dd51-4eda-9331-927390a1f6d5","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
